alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Orange; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 9:34AM EST until February 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST/8 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and Kentucky, including the following counties, in Indiana, Clark, Crawford, Dubois, Floyd, Harrison, Jefferson, Orange, Perry, Scott and Washington. In Kentucky, Breckinridge, Hancock, Henry, Jefferson, Meade, Oldham and Trimble. * WHEN...Until 9 PM EST/8 PM CST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Crawford; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Orange; Scott; Washington
